item.title: Chrome Hack to Save Chat GPT converstion as Markdown
item.author: Andreas De Rosi
item.description: I was having a conversation with Chat GPT and wanted to save it as a markdown file. I found a way to do it using Chrome DevTools. Here is the script I used to save the conversation as a markdown file. Chrome Script function h(html) { return html .replace(/<p>/g, '\n\n') .replace(/<\/p>/g, '') .replace(/<b>/g, '**') .replace(/<\/b>/g, '**') .replace(/<i>/g, '_') .replace(/<\/i>/g, '_') .replace(/<code[^>]*>/g, (match) => { const lm = match.match(/class="[^"]*language-([^"]*)"/); return lm ?

item.title: Git and Hugo Commands Cheat Sheet
item.author: Andrea De Rosi
item.description: Git Commands Cheat Sheet Note to my root: cd /path/to-folder/ Start Server: hugo server Stop Huger Server: Control + C git status git add . git commit -m “Your commit message here” – Commit the changes with a descriptive message: git push – Push the changes to GitHub After executing these commands, your Hugo site changes should be successfully committed and pushed to GitHub. Git Commands Help (git help -a) These are common Git commands used in various situations:
